intro: Agalinis albida, commonly known as the whitestem false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs.
